data.name: Validate German phone numbers
data.description:
This Kata is inspired by [Splitting phone numbers into their separate parts](https://www.codewars.com/kata/regular-expressions-groups-splitting-phone-numbers-into-their-separate-parts).

You can write German phone numbers in one of the following ways:
- +49 as country code prefix + area code w/o leading zero + the actual local phone number
- 0049 as country code prefix + area code w/o leading zero + the actual local phone number
- area code w/ leading zero + the actual local phone number
- the actual local phone number (w/o area code)

The following conventions may apply:

- area codes can be anything between 10 and 99999 with a leading zero.
- local phone numbers can be anything between 100 and 999999.

Your job is to validate either a given phone number is a valid phone number or not.

Following numbers are considered valid German phone numbers:

- +49 37322 123456
- 0049 37322 123456
- 037322 123456
- 123456
- +49 30 1234567
- 0049 30 1234567
- 030 1234567
- 1234567

Invalid German phone numbers:

- 0049 030 1234567
- 0049 037322 123456
- +49 037322 123456
- 37322 123456
- 30 1234567
- +49 030 1234567
- 0001 34 567890
- +01 34 567890
- +12 04 567890
- +12 034 567890
- +12 34 067895
- 034 067895
- 001 567890
- 098765

Return `True`, if the phone number is valid or return `False`, if it is invalid.

Good luck!
